body:
Hmmm. Re-reading the docs a bit more - it looks like the `ignores` array uses minimatch syntax - not `.gitignore` syntax like the `.eslintignore` that I was migrating from.

So the correct form of the ignore is instead `**/dist/**`.

So this isn't a bug - it's instead (imo) unclear documentation thing.
I was tricked because the example uses `"!node_modules/"` which looks like gitignore syntax.
It also lists `"node_modules/*"` with the comment "ignore its content" - but this wouldn't actually match the node module contents properly - it would only ignore any *files* within `node_modules` directly (i.e. `node_modules/foo/bar.js` would not be ignored).

This section probably needs another pass to help clarify the usage.
It would probably also be good to add an example of how one might migrate from a `.eslintignore` file.

> It also lists `"node_modules/*"` with the comment "ignore its content" - but this wouldn't actually match the node module contents properly - it would only ignore any _files_ within `node_modules` directly (i.e. `node_modules/foo/bar.js` would not be ignored).

In global ignores, patterns match directories too, so `node_modules/foo/bar.js` is ignored because it's in ignored directory `node_modules/foo` (the directory is matched by  `"node_modules/*"`). Global ignores work much like `.gitignore` (matching directories; unignoring) with enhanced syntax and in some cases indeed different semantics in patterns - a notable difference is the one you noticed, `dist` pattern matches only top-level `dist` file/directory.

> This section probably needs another pass to help clarify the usage.
> It would probably also be good to add an example of how one might migrate from a `.eslintignore` file.

I also think it would be good to improve this section and [migration guide](https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/migration-guide#ignoring-files).

issue.body:
### ESLint version

v8.55.0

### What problem do you want to solve?

After migrating my repository from `.eslintrc.js` to flat config `eslint.config.js`, I was confused by some additional linting errors that showed up. I then realized these linting errors were in files that were supposed to be ignored by `.eslintignore`. After doing some digging through ESLint github issues/PRs, I found out `.eslintignore` no longer works with flat config.

### What do you think is the correct solution?

1. Document that `.eslintignore` no longer works in the migration guide: https://eslint.org/docs/latest/use/configure/migration-guide
2. Most importantly, add an error or warning when `.eslintignore` is detected with flat config, similar to how we often show a warning when the user provides an option that has been removed/deprecated.

If we don't have automated detection for this, then inevitably a large percentage of users performing this migration will meet this same confusion, and some will forget to cleanup/delete their old `.eslintignore` file. Having an `.eslintignore` present with flat config is a recipe for confusion. I can imagine some users even trying to keep `.eslintignore` and `ignores` in `eslint.config.js` in sync because they aren't sure which they are supposed to use.

Ideally, we could throw an error to disallow this mistake entirely, especially since flat config isn't considered stable yet until ESLint v9. Otherwise, we can print a warning to the console. The error/warning message would describe the replacement for this file or link to documentation on it.

Concerns:
1. Is there any situation in which the user would need to ignore the presence of `.eslintignore`?

### Participation

- [X] I am willing to submit a pull request for this change.

### Additional comments

Are there any other old files we should warn about to ease the migration? Should we warn when both `.eslintrc.js` and `eslint.config.js` are present?

### Related

* https://github.com/eslint/eslint/issues/17822
* https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/16434
* https://github.com/eslint/eslint/pull/16355
